cluster_relations.rel_desc: Some caterpillars possess spines as a morphological feature.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: applies to some caterpillar species only

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Some caterpillars possess hairs as a morphological feature.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: applies to some caterpillar species only

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Antennae are an example of the new tissues and structures that form during metamorphosis.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Biological Structures and Substances in Butterfly Metamorphosis
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Biological Structures and Substances in Butterfly Metamorphosis

args.canonical_rel_desc: Subject organism possesses the object as a distinct morphological structure or body feature.
args.justification: Both relations describe caterpillars possessing specific body structures (spines, hairs). This is a consistent part/feature relation from organism to anatomical feature, so a unified predicate 'has_morphological_structure' is appropriate.

args.canonical_rel_desc: The subject set or collection of anatomical tissues/structures includes the object as one of its members or examples.
args.justification: This relation states that 'new tissues and structures' formed during metamorphosis include antennae as an example. This is a membership/collection-style inclusion between a set of structures and one specific structure, distinct from organism–feature possession, so a separate predicate 'includes_structure' is suitable.
Both relations link an organism (caterpillar) to its anatomical defensive structures (spines, hairs). They belong to the same family of organism–morphology feature relations.

This relation connects a category or set of anatomical structures ('new tissues and structures') to a specific instance ('antennae'), which fits a class of relations expressing membership of a structure in a structural set.

All three relations express part–whole or set–member composition: caterpillars composed of certain morphological structures (spines, hairs), and a set of new structures including antennae as a member example.
